questions.tooltip: A critical limit is the minimum or maximum value that must be met to ensure the CCP is under control. It must be measurable.
A precise value (e.g. >75°C, <4°C, pH <4.6) that separates safe from unsafe. It must be measurable in real-time.
Cite the source of your limit (e.g. FSA Guidelines, Regulation 852/2004) if known.
questions.placeholder: e.g., FSA Safe Catering Pack, Codex Alimentarius

questions.tooltip: Explain why your limit differs from common standards, if applicable.
Reference supporting the justification (e.g. validation report, regulatory guidance).
questions.placeholder: e.g., Validation report ID or standard clause

questions.tooltip: Monitoring is the real-time measurement or observation of a CCP to ensure it is within critical limits.

questions.placeholder: e.g., Temperature, Time, pH, Visual check
e.g., Probe thermometer check, visual inspection

questions.tooltip: Specify the measurement device. Auditors need to see that the instrument is appropriate for the parameter and has a known accuracy.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Calibrated digital probe thermometer (±0.5 °C accuracy)

questions.tooltip: How often is the monitoring instrument checked or calibrated? EC 852/2004 Annex II Ch. IX requires measurement equipment to be calibrated at appropriate intervals.

questions.placeholder: e.g., Every 2 hours, Twice per shift, Weekly

questions.tooltip: Corrective actions describe what happens when monitoring shows a critical limit has been exceeded, including how control is restored.

questions.text: What action is taken if the critical limit is exceeded?
questions.tooltip: Immediate action to bring the process back under control (e.g. continue cooking, discard product).
questions.placeholder: e.g., Continue cooking until temp reached, Discard product

questions.text: How is the cause of deviation corrected?
questions.tooltip: Explain how you fix the underlying issue (e.g. repair fridge, retrain staff) to prevent recurrence.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Call engineer to repair oven, Retrain staff on procedure

questions.tooltip: Verification confirms that the HACCP system is working as intended (e.g. reviewing records, calibration, testing).

questions.placeholder: e.g., Review of temperature records, Calibration of probe

questions.text: What records are maintained for this CCP?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Temperature Log Sheet, Corrective Action Log
